creator: steve_l@iseran.com
text:
When there are any classpath issues stopping crimson.jar being found, this 
doesnt surface till you get the exception
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError

	at org.apache.batik.dom.util.SAXDocumentFactory.createDocument
(SAXDocumentFactory.java:181)

	at org.apache.batik.dom.svg.SAXSVGDocumentFactory.createDocument
(SAXSVGDocumentFactory.java:95)

	at org.apache.batik.dom.svg.SAXSVGDocumentFactory.createDocument
(SAXSVGDocumentFactory.java:161)

	at org.apache.batik.transcoder.XMLAbstractTranscoder.transcode
(XMLAbstractTranscoder.java:109)

This exception isnt trappable or informative, so it is the wrong way for this 
error to surface. Better to check for null or whatever and throw something we 
can deal with.

creator: hillion@apache.org
text:
This exception is not caused by an error during the SAX parser creation but by 
invalid DOM bindings (and then invalid bytecodes leading to a 
NoSuchMethodException) in the classpath.
There is nothing to do to provide a better error handling since this is an 
unexpected error.
